buffer_copy_from_vertex_buffer: This function can be used to copy some (or all) of the vertex data stored in one vertex buffer into a previously created regular buffer. When copying from a vertex buffer into a regular buffer with this function, both buffers must have previously been created (using the vertex_create_buffer() and buffer_create() functions, for example). You can specify the range of vertex data that you wish to copy into the buffer, where the start vertex can be anywhere between 0 and the number of vertices -1, and you can give the number of vertices from that point on to copy. You can use the function vertex_get_number() on the vertex buffer to get the total number of vertices stored. Finally you give the buffer index to copy the vertex data into, as well as a data offset to define the position to copy the vertex data to in the destination buffer.
The index of the vertex buffer to copy from.
The total number of vertices to use.
The index of the buffer to copy to.
